page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: Our area is completly rural it has 3 hamlets and 4 small villages but no towns.In those villages there are 3 churches,2 pubs,1 post office/village shop,telephone boxes,post boxes and a school.There used to be more schools in the area but they closed down as people moved to the towns to live.The housing is now a mixture of cottages, houses and concil houses. The landscape of our area consists of improved grazing, rough grazing, crops and a small amount of woodland. The woodland is called Langford Common which is a nature reserve. It has footpaths through it and the trees are a mixture of oak, ash, beech, hazel, birch and a few scots pine trees. There are many different kinds of farms including dairy, sheep, chicken and mixed.
